conclusion: Need to figure out where the liquid will flow after it comes out from points A, B, and C, and how it will be directed by the baffles into containers D, E, or F.
There are three inlet points: A, B, and C, each releasing liquid, and these liquids are supposed to be directed into one of the containers D, E, or F.
Various colored bars and arrows indicating the positions of A, B, C, D, E, F, and G.
Baffles are likely the horizontal and diagonal lines in the middle section.
Point A is connected to a pink rectangle at the top.
Point B is connected to a green rectangle next to A.
Point C is connected to a blue rectangle next to B.
At the bottom, there are five house-shaped containers: two on the left are cyan and gray, then three on the right are green, yellow, and another yellow.
The central area has several diagonal lines: white, yellow, blue, orange, and black.
Diagonal lines are probably the baffles that will direct the flow of liquid from A, B, and C to one of the containers below.
Need to trace the path of the liquid from each inlet (A, B, C) through the baffles to determine which container it ends up in.
Point A is connected to the pink rectangle at the top.
From point A, there's a white diagonal line descending to the left.
Below the white diagonal line, there's a black diagonal line ascending to the right.
Further down from point A, there's an orange horizontal line.
Liquid from A hits the white baffle and is deflected towards the left or right, then hits the black baffle, and so on, eventually reaching one of the containers.
For points B and C, their paths would be influenced by the other baffles present.
Point B is connected to the green rectangle next to A.
